intro: Gaertnera junghuhniana, commonly known as the Hainan hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant in warmer regions.
